name: Palomar San Diego, A Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Warning, this review could get gooshy. First, you should know something about me. I'm typically looking for a good deal, but I've got high standards, so there's usually some tension there. I'm brand-loyal, to a point. Good examples - Lululemon, Apple, and Kimpton. Never thought I'd be so pleased with a hotel chain. Thus, this review.
reviews.title: Kimpton, you had me at hello...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I travel to San Diego for work 1 week of every month. Since work is 1 block from the Hotel Palomar, I really try to stay here. Not only is it convenient, it's a KIMPTON! For those of you that haven't experienced a Kimpton, I'll start with friendly service, attitude-free staff, cool modern decor, FREE WINE HOUR with live music sometimes, comfy beds, good food, nice showers with ceiling showerheads, fabulous upgrades (even to the baller suite once - wow), great nearby restaurants, and a wonderful running route down to the water.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Gaslamp District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really like this hotel, can you tell?
reviews.title: Pleasant Gaslamp stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel when it was called the Sei and not under Kimpton management so I knew what the interior was like but the Kimpton touches definitely added to the experience. The hotel is located right in the Gaslamp and is walking distance to lots of restaurants including the Horton Mall in case you want to do some shopping. The hotel staff is very friendly -- as you would expect from Kimpton. I asked for a suggested running route and they had a nice map with different routes near the hotel. I mentioned I was interested in getting a massage and they gave me a$25 off coupon for the spa. The room was spacious, well designed with modern decor. The rooms have not been updated since the takeover from Sei although they don't need it as the Sei decor was very Kimpton-ish. The one complaint I have about the room is the desk is adjacent to the dresser on which the TV sits so it's really crowded if you use a laptop and even more so if you get takeout and attempt to eat from the desk while you also have your laptop going. I stayed for nearly a week so I did a lot of work from my hotel room and the crowding was sort of annoying, not awful or unbearable though. I used the hotel gym and it was well equipped and I never had to wait for any machines. One suggestion: they really need to close the door to the gym so it can maintain a cool temperature. It was extremely hot in there due to the door being left open and the room being unable to stay cool despite the air conditioning which was set at 66 degrees. They also need to put the gym location on the signs in the elevator. For two days I kept forgetting what floor it was on and it wasn't listed on any of the elevator signs. My rate included free continental breakfast so I took advantage of that one morning and it was pleasant. Very quick, efficient (which I needed since I was already running late) and a filling, delicious meal. I did not order room service or eat dinner in the hotel restaurants so can't comment on that. I did enjoy the free coffee in the hotel lobby each morning which was a treat as I left on my way to the office. I was at the hotel for 5 nights and overall it was a very pleasant experience. I've stayed at other hotels for this length of time and it's hard to feel comfortable and "at home" for that long in a hotel and that was not the case here. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in Gaslight District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in a Kimpton before. Stylish public areas and functional rooms as before. Good location for the Gaslamp area. Superb breakfast, and the restaurant staff were generally really good and helpful.
reviews.title: Pay for the pool?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We escaped for the weekend and the Palomar SD was a great place. The hotel decor is awesome and staff wonderful. Kimpton is our first choice in any city and places like the Palomar are why!
reviews.title: Love It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Palomar is located within walking distance to the Gas Lamp Quarter, Seaport Village, Harbor, Little Italy and more.
reviews.title: What an amazing trip ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were down in San Diego for our "babymoon". I booked the Palomar San Diego without knowing much about the hotel. I can say with certainty that it was an absolutely amazing experience -- one of the best we have ever had. The hotel is beautiful -- the decor is hip, and the rooms are massive. What really stood out to me, however, was the service. We were greeted by Johnson Menezes at the front desk. From the moment we met him, he ensured that every element of our stay was taken care of. From helping us get reservations at the perfect place for dinner, or setting us up with an absolutely amazing room with a view, Johnson really looked out for us. I credit a lot of our fantastic experience to his expertise! Thanks!
reviews.title: Stop Looking, Just Book It... Now.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I travelled from Calgary, Alberta to San Diego and searched online for a hotel and ended up booking the Kimpton Palomar.
reviews.title: Excellent weekend escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Man, we were not disappointed. When you travel to a new city, it's kind of a crap shoot to find a hotel based on pictures and reviews, because they are always mixed. Well, I can tell you this place won't disappoint.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here twice now- 1st time was in August when we got married at this amazing hotel and then this past weekend for the Phillies/Padres baseball games. Let me tell you that this place does NOT disappoint. The location is great, the people are amazing, the food is to die for, and the decor- one of my fav parts of this place (hence having my wedding here for the amazing photo ops). The restaurant is very unique with it's food selection, the drinks are yummy, the rooftop pool area/bar is fun to lounge around (they even gave us a free sample of the BEST ceviche I've ever tasted), and the staff want to do what they can to make sure you feel like a welcomed guest. I look forward to many more stays at this hotel and hope that everyone reads this gives it a chance- because it's the BEST!
reviews.title: This place is a MUST!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel about once a month and prefer to stay at fairly nice resorts/hotels. From the reviews and pictures I'd seen of Hotel Palomar I was excited to stay here during my three day weekend for a friend's wedding in San Diego. I may have had too high of expectations going into it, but at $300/night I didn't think it was unrealistic.
reviews.title: unimpressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great in relation to the gas lamp district, restaurants, bars, etc. The room was a bit small, but nice, loved the hardwood floors, and the bathroom/shower were fantastic. The best part of the hotel were the doormen, hands down. They were always helpful, chill, conversational, and good guys.
reviews.title: Brown, brown and brown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: With that being said, I do not think I will be returning to the Hotel Palomar for multiple reasons. During breakfast both mornings we were having to swat at the fruit flies constantly. There was not an abundance of them, but it seemed there was one circling the table and our food at all times. If you are looking to relax at the pool, get some sun, and have a few drinks....this may not be the place for you. The pool is located on the north side of the building, which means the sun is blocked from the entire pool area until about 1:30 in the afternoon. The pool bar was supposed to be open at noon, but the bartender did not arrive until 12:15 and took 45 minutes to set up the bar area. The upkeep on the wood and rusted metal for the furniture of the cabanas and beds near the bar is highly lacking. The planters in the wood behind the couch/beds near the bar are trashy, filled with junk, mixed dirt & rocks, and really should either be filled in with sand or rock.....or actually have plants in there to hide the trashy look.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the individual whipping up the cold menu at the pool was awesome and his food was great.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the Gaslamp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Asked for foam pillows, and I received no pillow cases, and one had old blood stains on it.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, bloody pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Trip Advisor (TA) to plan our 5-night vacation to San Diego and learned about the Palomar Hotel. This was my first visit to San Diego and my first experience at a Kimpton property. Our travel was in late April.
reviews.title: We Have a Winner!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel gets high marks for all the basics that I look for: clean; well kept; friendly staff; makes customer satisfaction a priority.
reviews.title: Fantastic end to our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is located at the edge of the Gas Lamp District. The aesthetics of the hotel are very welcoming. Common areas (lobby, lounge, restaurant, pool/bar) are nicely furnished with numerous seating areas containing over-stuffed chairs, sofas, and lounge chairs. The staff is also very welcoming. The bellmen, front desk staff, concierge, and management staff were all extroverted and friendly.
reviews.title: Class Act

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was upgraded to a “Flat” which was huge with a nice view of the city. The room was impeccably clean. The kitchen was awesome! My only criticism of the room is that the seating in the room (sofa, dining room chairs, bar stools) was very uncomfortable. The uncomfortable sofa was the only seating in the living room - no other chairs. The seating situation was very surprising since the seating throughout the hotel was so comfortable. The room was otherwise amazing! The housekeeping staff were very responsive to our few requests.
reviews.title: Great hotel with Amazing service

description: Move into luxury and sophisticated, art-filled style at Hotel Palomar San Diego. In the center of downtown arts and culture, surrounded by award-winning theaters and nightlife and just steps from San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter, our boutique Kimpton Hotel is a top choice for both work and play.
